intro: Dolicholus puberulus, commonly known as the hairy dolicholus, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, and its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds. Dolicholus puberulus is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
